title: A teacher tased by the LAPD died of an enlarged heart and cocaine use, coroner says
description: Keenan Anderson, a Black man, died hours after Los Angeles police officers repeatedly tased him in January. The coroner's office said the manner of death was not determined.

title: Strawberry moon forever — or at least this weekend
description: June's full moon, also known as "strawberry moon," is lighting up the sky all weekend. The best time to see it is Saturday night.

title: A federal judge rejects Tennessee's anti-drag law as too broad and vague
description: U.S. District Judge Thomas Parker says the first-in-the-nation law designed to place strict limits on drag shows is unconstitutional.

title: Doctors rally to defend abortion provider Caitlin Bernard after she was censured
description: Hundreds of Indiana doctors across specialties say a decision by the state's Medical Licensing Board to reprimand Dr. Caitlin Bernard sets a dangerous precedent about what doctors can and can't say.

title: 3 Israeli soldiers were killed along the Egyptian border, military says
description: A gunbattle involving an Egyptian police officer in southern Israel along the border left three Israeli soldiers dead, the army said. It was a rare instance of deadly violence along the frontier.

title: Heart transplant recipient dies after being denied meds in jail; ACLU wants an inquiry
description: Dexter Barry pleaded with police, jail staff and a court judge that he needed his medication to maintain his heart transplant. The ACLU is urging a state investigation into the 54-year-old's death.

title: Amazingly, the U.S. job market continues to roar. Here are the 5 things to know
description: Employers added a whopping 339,000 jobs last month, a stunningly strong number. Here are some of the key takeaways of the country's red hot labor market.

title: A woman is in custody after refusing tuberculosis treatment for more than a year
description: A judge in Tacoma, Wash., approved a civil warrant for the woman's arrest after 16 requests for intervention from local health officials. Police observed the woman board a bus and visit a casino.

title: Vietnam faces criticism for arresting climate activist as it closes clean energy deal
description: Hoang Hong, founder of the environmental group CHANGE VN, was arrested Wednesday on tax charges, the U.N. says. Human rights experts say Vietnamese officials use the law to target civil society.

title: Defense Secretary Austin says U.S. won't stand for 'coercion and bullying' from China
description: Speaking at the so-called Shangri-La Dialogue, Austin also assured Beijing that the United States remains committed to maintaining the status quo on Taiwan and would prefer dialogue over conflict.
